(a) power, authority, weight, especially: moral authority, influence, (b) in a quasi-personal sense, derived from later Judaism, of a spiritual power, and hence of an earthly power.

1.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

1.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

1.long: I care for, attend, serve, treat, especially of a physician; hence: I heal.

2.brief: I send forth, send, send away, dismiss
2.long: I send forth, send (as a messenger, commission, etc.), send away, dismiss.

kingship, sovereignty, authority, rule, especially of God, both in the world, and in the hearts of men; hence: kingdom, in the concrete sense.

4.long: into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

4.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
4.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
a house, household, dwelling; meton: goods, property, means.

4.long: I go in, come in, enter.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there.

6.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.

6.brief: I bring good news, preach good tidings
6.long: I bring good news, preach good tidings, with or without an object, expressing either the persons who receive the good news or the good news itself (the good news being sometimes expressed as a person).

6.long: I care for, attend, serve, treat, especially of a physician; hence: I heal.

58.brief: I rest, recline, make to yield
58.long: trans: I rest, recline; I bend, incline; I cause to give ground, make to yield; intrans: I decline, approach my end.

59.long: (denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

59.brief: I come or go away from, depart, return

60.brief: I send away, release, remit, forgive, permit
60.long: (a) I send away, (b) I let go, release, permit to depart, (c) I remit, forgive, (d) I permit, suffer.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse.

60.brief: I announce throughout, spread the news of
60.long: I announce throughout (the world), spread the news of, give notice of, teach.
kingship, sovereignty, authority, rule, especially of God, both in the world, and in the hearts of men; hence: kingdom, in the concrete sense.
